Subject: Visual Arts
Text: By the end of Foundation, students describe experiences, observations, ideas and feelings about artworks they encounter at school, home and in the community, identifying what they enjoy and why.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They develop an understanding of visual arts conventions, skills and processes.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: Students use play, imagination and experimentation with materials and processes to create artworks.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They make and share artworks that communicate their experiences, observations and ideas.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: By the end of Level 2, students identify where they experience artworks.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They describe why and how people across cultures, communities, times, places and/or other contexts experience visual arts.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: Students experiment with visual arts processes, materials and visual conventions to create artworks.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They make and share artworks that communicate experiences, ideas and observations in informal settings.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: By the end of Level 4, students identify and describe the use of visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials in artworks they create and/or experience.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They recall where, when, why and/or how visual artists create and/or display artworks across cultures, times, places and other contexts, including the work of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: Students explore and experiment with visual conventions, materials and processes to develop their visual arts practice.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They use visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials to create artworks that communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They present and/or display their artworks and/or visual arts practice in formal and/or informal settings.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: By the end of Level 6, students explore the ways that visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials are combined in artworks they create and/or experience.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They describe how artworks created across cultures, times, places and other contexts communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They identify how visual arts are used to continue and revitalise cultures, including the work of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: Students develop ideas in artworks using visual conventions and visual arts processes.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They select and use visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials to create artworks that communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They present and/or display and discuss artworks in informal and formal settings.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: By the end of Level 8, students analyse how visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials are manipulated in artworks they create and experience.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They describe ways that visual artists across cultures, times, places and other contexts communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning through their visual arts practice including the artworks of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They identify and describe how and why respectful approaches are used in creating and responding to artworks.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: Students select and manipulate visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials to explore and develop ideas for artworks.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They document and reflect on their visual arts practice and use visual arts terminology.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They use visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials to create artworks that represent ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They curate, present and discuss exhibits and/or displays of their own and/or others’ artworks and/or visual arts practice for audiences.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: By the end of Level 10, students analyse and evaluate how and why visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials are manipulated in artworks they create and experience.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They evaluate how and why artists from across cultures, times, places and other contexts use visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials in their visual arts practice and/or artworks to communicate and/or challenge ideas, perspectives and meaning, including the practices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They evaluate how visual arts are used to represent, celebrate and challenge perspectives of Australian identity, including artworks by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: Students explore and respond to artworks and inspiration from multiple sources to develop and resolve artworks that communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They document, reflect on and annotate their own visual arts practice.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They select and apply skills, demonstrating an understanding of the use of visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials to create artworks.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They use visual conventions, visual arts processes and materials to create artworks that represent and/or communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Visual Arts
Text: They curate, critique and evaluate exhibitions of their own and/or others’ artworks and visual arts practice in different contexts, times and places for different audiences.
